binary.name: trim_grid
binary.syntax: trim_grid [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cn channel] [-exc stid...] [-i intt] name
trim_grid -new [-vb] [-sd yyyymmdd] [-st hr:mn] [-ed yyyymmdd] [-et hr:mn] [-ex hr:mn] [-cn channel] [-exc stid...] [-i intt] name

option.od: print the help message and exit.
verbose. Log information to the console.
extract starting from the date yyyymmdd.
extract starting from the time hr:mn.
stop extracting at the date yyyymmdd.
stop extracting at the time hr:mn.
extract an interval whose extent is hr:mn.
extract only those records from channel channel.
exclude data from the stations listed in stid which is a comma separated list of station identifier codes or numbers.
re-integrate the data so that each record is intt seconds in length.
filename of the grid format file to trim. If this is omitted, the file is read from standard input.
the input file is a grdmap format file.

synopsis.p: Extracts a section from a grid or grdmap format file.

description.p: Extracts a section from a grid or grdmap format file.
The extracted section is written to standard output.

example.description: Extracts a 3 hour period starting at 11:00UT from the file called "19981020.grd" to produce a file called "19981020.1100.grd". The status is logged to standard error.

Extracts a 4 hour period starting at 22:00UT on November 21, 1999 from the file "199911.grdmap" to produce the output file "199911.2100.grdmap". The records are re-integrated to produce records at 4-minute intervals.
Removes vectors from the Goose Bay and Kapuskasing Radars from the file "20001120.grd" to produce the file "20001120.2.grd"
